meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I woopsed the math problem and got the wrong answer.
meanings.sent2: She often woopsed when trying to tie her shoelaces.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor woopsed his lines, making the audience giggle.
meanings.sent4: The chef woopsed the recipe by adding too much salt, resulting in a salty dish.
meanings.sent5: The student woopsed the spelling bee by misspelling a simple word.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to express surprise or dismay.
meanings.sent1: Woopsed! I dropped my pencil on the floor.
meanings.sent2: Woopsed, I forgot to bring my umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: Woopsed, I accidentally bumped into the door while texting.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise outside made me woopsed in shock.
meanings.sent5: Woopsed! I almost spilled my drink on the new carpet.
